The CEO left a signed message to unlock the funds, but used an insecure exponent. Recover the original message from this signature: 0x79cbf57dde5f88de6da9501f38f0fd6678213e80103b5552e908b691cfb6c46a98a7a533667b5efe89e2198c0e46734a2ce6833cc957c5be30ed7564c468ee99

Public Key (n, e): (7780462102393228804973853714241461035279378333286907662198000939655016529868834959305377409296938045615227584369431911006667357829543605332569058319774463, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{ex0ixb4q}
ciphertext: 0x79cbf57dde5f88de6da9501f38f0fd6678213e80103b5552e908b691cfb6c46a98a7a533667b5efe89e2198c0e46734a2ce6833cc957c5be30ed7564c468ee99
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (7780462102393228804973853714241461035279378333286907662198000939655016529868834959305377409296938045615227584369431911006667357829543605332569058319774463, 3)
